intro: Helicteres rufipila, commonly known as the red-fruited sycamore, is a shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellowish flowers. The plant produces distinctive red, fleshy fruits that contain seeds surrounded by a fleshy, persistent calyx. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Helicteres rufipila is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and unique fruiting structures.
